required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 10, 2022
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Sodium Oligomannate (GV-971) in Participants With Mild to Moderate Alzheimer's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Multi-center, Randomized, Double-blind, Parallel-group, Placebo-controlled Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Sodium Oligomannate (GV-971) in Treatment of Mild to Moderate Alzheimer's Disease (GREEN MEMORY: GREen Valley 971 EvaluatioN Memory)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability and efficacy of GV-971 in mild to moderate Alzheimer's disease.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in the ADAS-cog/11 score
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Assessments Scale - cognitive (ADAS-cog/11) scale total score. The total score of ADAS-cog/11 is 0-70, with higher scores mean a worse outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in the ADCS-CGIC score
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline on Alzheimer's Disease Cooperative Study - Clinical Global Impression of Change (ADCS-CGIC) scale total score. The total score of ADCS-CGIC is 1-7, with higher scores mean a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in NPI score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Neuropsychiatric Inventory (NPI) score. The total score of NPI is 0-144, with higher scores mean a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in MMSE score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Mini Mental State Examination (MMSE) score. The total score of MMSE is 0-30, with higher scores mean a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in ADCS-ADL23 score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Cooperative Study - Activities of Daily Living; 23-item Scale (ADCS-ADL23) score. The total score of ADCS-ADL23 is 0-78, with higher scores mean a better outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in NPI caregiver items
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Neuropsychiatric Inventory (NPI) caregiver items . The total score of NPI caregiver items is 0-60, with higher scores mean a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in ZBI score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Zarit Burden Interview (ZBI) score. The total score of ZBI is 0-88, with higher scores mean a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the efficacy of GV-971 throughout the OLE period
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Alzheimer's Disease Assessments Scale - cognitive (ADAS-cog/11) scale total score. The total score of ADAS-cog/11 is 0-70, with higher scores mean a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the efficacy of GV-971 throughout the OLE period
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline on Alzheimer's Disease Cooperative Study - Clinical Global Impression of Change (ADCS-CGIC) scale total score. The total score of ADCS-CGIC is 1-7, with higher scores mean a worse outcome.

other_outcome.description: Determine serum levels of GV-971 in population PK

other_outcome.measure: Evaluate the effect of GV-971 on brain structure neurodegeneration
other_outcome.description: Changes from baseline in volumetric magnetic resonance imaging (MRI)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Mild to moderate AD per NIA-AA.
- History of cognitive and functional decline over at least 1 year.
- MMSE scores between 11 and 24 (inclusive) at baseline.
- Brain MRI scan show the highest possibility of AD.
- Have a study partner/caregiver.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of a dementia-related central nervous system disease other than AD.
- Major structural brain disease as judged by MRI.
- A resting heart rate of < 50 beats per minute (bpm) after 5 minutes of rest in sitting or supine position.
- Major medical illness or unstable medical condition within 6 months of screening.
- Concomitant use of AChEIs and/or memantine within 30 days before first MMSE score, and during the study.
- Inadequate hepatic function.
- Inadequate organ and marrow function.
- ECG clinically significant abnormalities.
